title: Understanding the Problem
text: The linear function is defined by $$L(x)=f{\left(a\right)}+\operatorname{f'}\left(a\right) \left(x-a\right)$$. This function L is also known as the linearization of f at $$x=a$$. When the linear approximation function is constant, $$\operatorname{f'}\left(a\right) \left(x-a\right)=0$$ such that $$f'(a)=0$$.
